org.orgName: United States. Circuit Court (District of Columbia)

div2.p: Dist of Columbia Washington, County Towit:

On this 14th January 1825 personally appears before me one of the justices of the peace in & for the County aforesaid Sally Williams & makes oath on the holy evangely of Almighty God that she has known negro Rebecca & her children who have petitioned for their freedom against Lloyd Pumphrey, in the Circuit Court of the District of Columbia, for Washington County, for many years, that she knew them before they came to George Town & when they lived in Fairfax County, State of Virginia, & owned by Thomas Sparling. That the said Thomas Sparling she has also known for many years- That at the time & for some time previous to of they Rebecca's removal to George Town with her children, about five years ago this Deponent was living in George Town, & that the said Sparling was in the constant habit of visiting her whenever he came to town & always made their house his visiting place when in town. That this said Sparling did not come to George Town with the said And that she never heard a person
of his residing in George Town or of his having real intent. That in February following the removal of said negroes the said Sparling called at this Deponents house in George Town, & Stated he was on his way to the town part of Virginia to cut wood- In the month next following this Deponent removed from George Town to Fairfax, On the plan which Sparling had inspired. That about fishing time of that year the said Sparling returned to Fairfax & came to the place then occupied by this Deponent, where he lived for some time until he was removed in consequence of witness to a Mr. Sewall, his brother in law in the neighborhood- That on the return of Sparling he said he had been down into Virginia cutting wood for a Mr.Lee & never did mention his residing in George Town. That this Dept. has known his an time & that he has continued to reside in Fairfax, Virginia & that the said Negroes have continued to reside here in George Town, their her removal-

Sworn to and subscribing before me
Sally Williams
Walter Newton

Negro Rebecca for herself & children
vs.
Lloyd Pumphrey
W. Brent will file this afft. in behalf of Petr.
